column4: I have cpufreq problems, tested with gerneric and pae kernel: http://pastie.org/942319 .. just starves at 800mhz 1 minute after boot ...
I have cpufreq problems, tested with gerneric and pae kernel: http://pastie.org/942319 .. just starves at 800mhz 1 minute after boot ...
network-manager does not consider to handle eth0, how do I convince it?
I have cpufreq problems, tested with gerneric and pae kernel: http://pastie.org/942319 .. just starves at 800mhz 1 minute after boot ... <- nobody an idea?
YOu want to undervolt your laptop?
I was just curious... I fyou load another (older) kernel?
nope. it is a completely fresh install from alternate.

As I understand, this is a regression, as probably it worked with previous version. I would first try an older kernel version (install an older kenrel), or even give a ekrnerl series like 2.6.33 a try. See if the problem persists.
does that mean it is a kernel bug then?
That's what we want to find out, aren't we? ;) Afterwards we can guess, that it is related tu cpufreq.
That would be my approach to the problem.
*sigh* always regressions ... :) lemme see, I have an older updated lappi here, tha actually *can* do scaling
Hardware is a complex thing ;) --> see win7 *rofl*

one thing, the installer asked if it should put only machine specific modules in initrd or the whole bunch, I went for the machine specific one, now on boot always it complain there is a moduler misisng, strange but possibly the cuplrit? and: how do I change that behaviour of initramfs?
I am not really used in using the alternate CD, but if you tried to 'sudo dpkg-reconfigure linux-image-<foo>', would that give you the possibility again to choose?
